channel.title: Making an area just for a player
channel.description: Okay...I want to make an area that all players on my server can teleport to, but when they are in, the players cannot see each other. Like a POH. Also, i would like the player to be able to make walls and other objects in that area..so yes it is basically a POH. any ideas???

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay, so…if its not too much to ask…could someone give me a code or something to add in? i could do the token thing and adding in a new char file line but i don’t know how to get it to + a house height thing? :S

Read full topic
item.source: Making an area just for a player

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:360227”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=456663.msg3343266#msg3343266 date=1284591037]
Save it as a token. This way it will load the heightLevel from the character file, instead of giving them a new one.
[/quote]Do you know what a token is =/

A token is usually part of a string array, not a normal identifier.

@Steve - They used the wrong words, they meant integer.[/quote]
I thought so.

Tokenization is the process of breaking a stream of text up into meaningful elements.

Read full topic
item.source: Making an area just for a player

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Save it as a token. This way it will load the heightLevel from the character file, instead of giving them a new one.[/quote]Do you know what a token is =/

A token is usually part of a string array, not a normal identifier.

@Steve - They used the wrong words, they meant integer.

Read full topic
item.source: Making an area just for a player

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=456663.msg3343205#msg3343205 date=1284588154]

Do you know how to allow a player to buy something then be able to teleport to it…but it teleports them to their own height level? E.g. if the initial players height level was 0…and another player had bought some land at height level 4 then when the second player bought a house it would boost their level to 8? So like…+4 to the highest playerheight? sort of.
[/quote]That is easy, make a new token called “househeight” and declare an integer that saves the height level of when you first went to your house. And to top it off, make the command or whatever take you to the heightlevel that the integer has saved for that player.

Instead of something such as heightLevel += 4; the general method designed was playerId*4; Though both will work, you must remember to tokenize the integers, or they will not be the same every time.[/quote]
Can I ask what you mean by… Tokenize?

Read full topic
item.source: Making an area just for a player

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“funnerscape, post:8, topic:360227”]Do you know how to allow a player to buy something then be able to teleport to it…but it teleports them to their own height level? E.g. if the initial players height level was 0…and another player had bought some land at height level 4 then when the second player bought a house it would boost their level to 8? So like…+4 to the highest playerheight? sort of.[/quote]That is easy, make a new token called “househeight” and declare an integer that saves the height level of when you first went to your house. And to top it off, make the command or whatever take you to the heightlevel that the integer has saved for that player.

Read full topic
item.source: Making an area just for a player

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“rickoez, post:7, topic:360227”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=456663.msg3343052#msg3343052 date=1284573808]

ooh okay…but will they have the ground below them?
[/quote]Yes. The ground resets every four floors. However, any NPCs/Players will dissapear.

but if you spawn also the npc’s that were there on the same cords but height:4 its possible ?[/quote]Yes, completely possible. Or if you just changed your NPC loading method so that it creates a NPC on height 4 for each spawn, it would be faster.

Technically, you could write an entire server using different heights, such as height 4 is a pvp world, height 8 is a skilling world, and height 0 (normal) is the normal world.

Read full topic
item.source: Making an area just for a player

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @rickoez rickoez
item.description:
@rickoez wrote:

Add the sp and the add object command with player rights = 0 from the tut section.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an area just for a player
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ooooh thanks guys this is really helpful! Do you know how to allow a player to buy something then be able to teleport to it…but it teleports them to their own height level? E.g. if the initial players height level was 0…and another player had bought some land at height level 4 then when the second player bought a house it would boost their level to 8? So like…+4 to the highest playerheight? sort of.

Also, how can i make a player spawn items for good, like making a poh?

Thanks!

Read full topic
